channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Significant litter along B4634 Old Gloucester Road between M5 flyover and Tewkesbury Road, 31st August
item.description:
There is a substantial litter problem along the B4634 (Old Gloucester Road) in Cheltenham, specifically on the stretch between the M5 flyover bridge and the junction with Tewkesbury Road. Both verges and embankments are heavily affected, with a wide range of rubbish including bottles, cans, fast-food packaging, and other debris clearly visible from the road. The litter is unsightly, creates an unpleasant impression for road users entering Cheltenham, and poses risks to wildlife and the local environment. The volume suggests it has built up over a long period without adequate clearance. Please could a clean-up be arranged for this section of the road as soon as possible, and ideally with measures put in place to ensure it is maintained regularly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: You have not cleared the path, 31st August
item.description:
HI, I reported this issue in 8th July - Someone has done 85% of the job but not cleared the whole footpath. In fact either the contracters removed my barbed wire fence or someone of the general public has vandalised it to now get access the full length of the path. It is just NOT acceptable someone has done this. This needs to be sorted this week - The public footpath has not been usable for 6 months and then someone comes and does 85% of the job - Why Just Why Reported via desktop in the Obstruction caused by tree category anonymously at 21:01, Tuesday 8 July 2025 using FixMyStreet Pro Sent to Gloucestershire County Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7830137. The whole PUBLIC FOOTPATH is overgrown yet again. Reported every year and still not maintained...it needs clearing. Now going over fences and into housing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Noverton Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains / bad smells, 31st August
item.description:
Outside number 25,27,29 bad drainage smells on the pavement , and direct outside our front door steps, making way into house, the drains fill up very quick, it’s been ongoing for 4-5 months now and went go away and getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Rosehill Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Significant litter problem (Old Gloucester Road, B4634), 31st August
item.description:
There is a significant litter problem along the Old Gloucester Road (B4634). The verges and laybys between the M5 flyover and Tewkesbury Road in Cheltenham are heavily strewn with rubbish, including bottles, cans, food packaging, and other debris. It gives a very poor impression of the area and may also present hazards to wildlife and road users. A thorough litter pick is needed along this section to bring it back to a clean and safe condition. Thank you for your attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concrete blocks obstructing bridleway, 31st August
item.description:
Since the claydon solar farm development has begun. The public bridleway that runs through it has become dangerous for horse riders trying to ride one of the only bridleways in the area. Concrete blocks have been installed by the developers obstructing the bridleway and becoming a danger to the horses. Aswell as that the ground is incredibly hard and juttery as a result of the bridleway being used by construction vehicles adding yet another danger to our only bridleway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cavity opening under tarmac., 31st August
item.description:
On the cross roads of shurdington Road and moor end drive a cavity is opening j der the road surface causing it to sump and start to collapse. This has been previously patched with no attempt to solve the root cause and so it’s happening again - I suggest this time you check under the surface rather than bodge again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
